intro: Eriosema rotundifolium, commonly known as the round-leaf eriosema, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in grassland and woodland habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercialized.
